intro: Lessingianthus concepcionis, commonly known as the Concepción sunflower, is a herbaceous plant native to South America, specifically Bolivia and Argentina. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and medicinal properties. The plant features upright stems with lance-shaped leaves that are hairy and have a rough texture. Its bright yellow flowers bloom in clusters, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and traditional use in herbal medicine.
